action.action-desc: Mr. Brady of Pennsylvania introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act to enhance the protection of credit ratings of active duty military personnel who are activated for military service.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Heroes Credit Protection Act.

section.header: Protection of credit ratings of persons activated for military service

paragraph.text: The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (50 U.S.C. App. 501 et seq.) is amended by inserting at the end of title I the following new section:

section.header: Protection of credit ratings of persons activated for military service

subsection.header: Requirements of Notation of Delinquent or Slow Payment due to Military Service
subsection.text: Any person or entity engaged in the practice of assembling or evaluating consumer credit information that receives from a creditor a negative report of nonpayment or late payment with respect to a qualifying account of a person in military service shall enter with that negative report a notation that the account is delinquent or paid slowly due to military service.
Any future potential creditor of such person who receives a credit report that includes a notation required by subsection (a) shall disregard any negative information so noted in the credit report.

For purposes of this section, a qualifying account is an account that was opened by a person in military service before the date on which that person entered that period of military service, but only with respect to obligations incurred before such date.

paragraph.text: The table of contents in section 1(b) of such Act is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 109 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 110. Protection of credit ratings of persons activated for military service.

subsection.text: Section 110 of the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act, as added by subsection (a), shall apply with respect to a period of military service (as defined in such Act) that is being performed by a person on the date of the enactment of this Act or to which a person is ordered on or after such date.
